S0012-d-03-09-98-SSAM.Narrative: THIS INCIDENT OCCURRED DURING A SWITCHING OPERATION WHILE KICKING WITH A CUT OF 56 CARS AND 2 LOCOMOTIVES.  THE CARS WERE BEING SWITCHED FROM THE MAIN LINE TRACK THROUGH A TURNOUT AND INTO AN INDUSTRYTRACK.  APPROXIMATELY ONE-HALF OF THE TRAIN WAS ON THE MAIN LINE AND ONE-HALF WAS ON THE INDUSTRY TRACK AT THE TIME THAT THE DRAFT GEAR CAME OUT OF CAR WC 26124.  RE-ENACTING THE INCIDENT SHOWED THATTHE FORCES OF THE TRAIN ALONG WITH THE GRADES WERE NOT ENOUGH TO CAUSE THIS DRAFT GEAR TO MALFUNCTION.  THE SIMULATION OF THE EVENT SHOWED THAT THE DRAFT GEAR (DRAFT SILL) MUST HAVE BEEN IN A WEAKENED CONDTION TO ALLOW A MODERATE LEVEL OF FORCE TO CAUSE THE DRAFT GEAR TO COME OUT OF THE CAR.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

EQ980303-d-03-12-98-LI.Narrative: THE TRAIN CREW OF RUN NUMBER 86 WAS INSTRUCTED TO MOVE TWO MU CARS 8 TRACK TO NUMBER 4 TRACK IN HEMPSTEAD YARD.  THE EQUIPMENT RECEIVING THE ADD ON OF CARS, WAS STANDING ON 4 TRACK WITH THE BRAKE PIPEFULLY CHARGED ON THE 6 CAR CONSIST.  AS THE TWO CONSISTS WERE COUPLED (2 CARS TO 6) THE AIR BRAKE SYSTEM OF THE ENTIRE CONSIST REMAINED FULLY CHARGED.  THIS RESULTED IN AN AUTOMATIC RELEASE OF THE TRAIN BRAKES, WHICH ENABLED THE TRAIN TO ACCEPTED TRACTION POWER AND SUDDENLY MOVED EASTWARD STRIKINGTHE BUMPER BLOCK.  AS A RESULT OF THIS ACCIDENT, A LIRR EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE DEPARTMENT PROCEDURE NOTICE HAS BEEN DISTRIBUTED TO ALL RESPONSIBLE EMPLOYEES, INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING:  ALL CAR INSPECTORS ARE REMINDED THAT FOLLOWING ALL BRAKE TESTS, TRAIN CONSISTS LEFT STANDING UNATTENDED MUST HAVE HAND BRAKES PROPERLY APPLIED.  THIS EMPLOYEE.NOTICE WAS DISTRIBUTED ON 4/2/98.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
